title: Middle school principal in Maine draws criticism after dressing as ICE agent for Halloween
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Mt. Blue Middle School principal James Black criticized for wearing an ICE costume at a Halloween event.
Superintendent Christian Elkington stated the situation happened off school grounds, noting the district's response follows internal practices.
Project Relief Maine denounced the costume, emphasizing its impact on immigrant students who fear ICE.

title: What Christian Gonzalez said about his head injury
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots' Christian Gonzalez says he's OK after exiting Sunday’s game with a head injury in the fourth quarter.
Gonzalez underwent concussion protocol after a play with Atlanta's Drake London but was cleared to return.
The Patriots won by one point, marking their closest victory this season, despite Gonzalez's brief exit.

title: South End residents say they picked up 180 needles in less than a week at neighborhood park
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: South End volunteers collected nearly 180 discarded needles in less than a week at Southwest Corridor Park.
City Councilor Ed Flynn calls for reduced needle distribution and improved drug crisis management in Boston.
Residents used collected needles to form 'SOS' as a plea to address safety concerns in children's play areas.

title: What Kevin Durant said about Jayson Tatum’s Achilles recovery, chances of returning this year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kevin Durant comments on Jayson Tatum's Achilles recovery, noting Tatum is ahead of typical rehab milestones.
Durant, familiar with Achilles injuries, praises Tatum for being able to dunk six months post-surgery.
Tatum may return later this NBA season; Durant supports the possibility but advises taking recovery day by day.

title: Amid tragedy, childhood friends DeMario Douglas and Terrell Jennings persevere in Patriots’ win
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: DeMario Douglas and Terrell Jennings scored touchdowns in the Patriots' 24-23 win over the Falcons.
Both Douglas and Jennings mourned a family friend, 'Tiger,' who passed away the day before the game.
Douglas achieved a career-high 100 receiving yards; Jennings scored his first NFL touchdown after being promoted.

title: Mike Vrabel shares message to Patriots, Drake Maye after nail-biting win over Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots secured a narrow 24-23 victory over the Atlanta Falcons at Gillette Stadium.
Mike Vrabel emphasized the importance of joy and resilience despite the Patriots' uneven performance against the Falcons.
Drake Maye, while critical of his turnovers, threw for 259 yards and two touchdowns in Sunday's win.

title: Former Newton Mayor Setti Warren dies ‘unexpectedly’ at 55
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Setti Warren, former Newton mayor and first African American elected to the position in Massachusetts, died at 55.
Warren's contributions as mayor included improving schools, transportation planning, and advancing innovation in Newton.
Warren was also Director of the Institute of Politics at Harvard Kennedy School, fostering debate and guiding students.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against Falcons
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: DeMario Douglas achieved his first career 100-yard receiving game, contributing significantly to the Patriots' win over the Falcons.
K’Lavon Chaisson was the only Patriot with multiple tackles for loss and has 5.5 sacks in the last three games.
The Patriots' offensive line struggled, allowing six sacks, and the Falcons capitalized on mismatches to score against Marcus Jones.

title: Boston residents say they feel safer downtown compared to last year in new survey
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Survey shows 66.3% of Boston residents feel safer downtown than earlier in 2024, mid-2025 survey reports.
Despite improved safety perception, 92% of survey respondents cite public safety as a pressing downtown concern.
Retail vacancies in downtown Boston are at their lowest post-COVID rate, attributed to increased safety perception.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ 24-23 win over the Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots extend win streak to six games with a 24-23 victory over the Falcons at Gillette Stadium.
Quarterback Drake Maye recorded 259 passing yards and two touchdowns but threw two costly turnovers.
Falcons' Parker Romo missed a critical extra-point kick, securing a narrow win for New England.
